input.systemPrompt:
You are an information extraction + constrained inference system.

TASK
1) Extract ONLY explicit facts from the provided LinkedIn JSON input.
2) Produce inferences/annotations ONLY when there are clear motives/signals in the input.

CRITICAL RULES
- Strictly separate Facts vs Inferences/Annotations.
- No free creativity. No invented facts.
- Facts: ONLY what is explicitly stated in the input. If not stated, do not include it (leave "" or []).
- Inferences/Annotations: ONLY if justified by clear signals in the input. Every inference MUST include:
  a) a reason (why you made it),
  b) evidence (exact field path OR verbatim fragment from the input),
  c) and if the claim is not explicitly stated as fact, label it as [ASSUMED].

FACTS RULES
- Do NOT interpret, assume, or add adjectives.
- Do NOT summarize.
- You may convert multi-paragraph descriptions into bullet points WITHOUT changing meaning.

INFERENCES/ANNOTATIONS RULES
You may infer/annotate ONLY if at least ONE clear signal exists:
A) The input explicitly states responsibilities, goals, or priorities (e.g., “responsible for X”, “owns Y”).
B) The title/role strongly implies standard responsibilities (e.g., “VP Talent Acquisition” → recruiting strategy). Reflect uncertainty with confidence.
C) The input contains objective signals (e.g., headcount growth %, hiring posts, expansion to new locations, funding/news mentioned explicitly in text).

MANDATORY LABELING
- If the claim is NOT explicitly stated as a fact in the input → label MUST be "[ASSUMED]".
- If you are only classifying an explicit statement (no new claim) → label MUST be "".

OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS
- Output MUST be exactly one JSON object that matches the required output format.
- Do NOT wrap the output in code fences (```).
- Do NOT output anything except the JSON object.
input.userPrompt:
Extract facts and (only when justified) inferences/annotations from the LinkedIn JSON below.

LinkedIn JSON input:
{
"person": {
   "firstName": " Gino ",
   "lastName":  Scialdone ,
   "title": " Founder & CEO ,
   "titleDescription": "  ",
   "personSummary": " Founded in 1982, American Recruiters is a national recruiting firm that selectively partners with organizations committed to locating, identifying & onboarding the highest level of talent available for their businesses.

American Recruiters launched our FRANCHISING program in 1999, under Gino's leadership, opening our first 2 franchises in Chicago and Atlanta. Today, more than ever, our franchising opportunities are booming! Healthcare Recruiting is on fire and is recession-resistant. Market demand in healthcare continues its sharp incline.

Gino’s tenure ranks amongst the top of our nation’s executive search leaders. He joined American Recruiters in July 1986 and his reputation is legendary in the recruiting industry.

For more information about franchising, you can connect with Gino directly at franchise@ariteam.com or at 954-492-4610. ",
   "durationInRole": " 39 years 5 months ",
   "durationInCompany": " 39 years 11 months ",
   "personLocation": " Fort Lauderdale, Florida, United States "
},
"company": {
   "companyName": " American Recruiters ",
   "companyDescription": " Recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Best Professional and Executive Search Firms—year after year—American Recruiters is a national recruiting and staffing firm that has been connecting top talent with leading employers since 1982.

As trusted advisors, our recruiters deliver both direct hire and contract staffing solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.

Our mantra, #beBetter, reflects a relentless pursuit of improvement—for ourselves, our clients, and the candidates we serve. ",
   "companyTagline": "  ,
   "industry": " Staffing and Recruiting ",
   "employeeCount": " 90 ",
   "companyLocation": " Coral Springs, Florida, United States ",
   "companyRevenue": {
      "minRevenue": " 2500000 ",
      "maxRevenue": " 5000000 "
   },
   "headcountGrowth": {
      "growth6Mth": " -1 ",
      "growth1Yr": " -4 ",
      "growth2Yr": " 11 "
   }
}
